Kirby's dream course is one of my
favorite games in the SNES library now
initially growing up I didn't have my
own Super Nintendo but my cousins did
and every time I went over their house
there were two games I would look
forward to playing the most those games
were Kirby super star and Kirby's Dream
course I think this game was my first
introduction to some sort of competitive
game outside of something obvious like
Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter when we
played this game I was out for blood
this games basically mini-golf mixed
with pool mixed with Kirby and it for
some reason works there's a ton of
stages to play through and each course
has its own theme now the object of the
game is well to get the ball in the hole
but it's a bit more complicated than
that
see to even have the course and hole
appear at all you need to defeat all but
one enemy in each stage by knocking into
them once all other enemies are defeated
the last one will vanish and a hole will
show up in its place it's not that
simple though because while playing in
two-player mode which honestly is the
biggest draw for this game you also need
to obtain more stars than your opponent
before sinking a shot each time an enemy
is defeated they leave behind a star
that is then collected but then can be
stolen by your opponent if they then
roll over the same star it's less about
sinking a shot first and more about
collecting as many stars as possible and
making it into the hole before your
opponent has
chance to steal in typical Kirby fashion
there are also power-ups you can obtain
which either give you more variation in
how you can shoot or make it easier to
knock out enemies also there's a ton of
mechanics that switch up gameplay as
each course goes on this is really just
an overall great game that can get super
competitive when you play with a friend
but to be honest this game is good
